content: This could be revolutionary, but in my 20+ years of experience (on both the design and code sides), the developers don’t want to worry about the bi-directional update path of both design and code affecting the same assets. In other words, once the visual language is established with a baseline version of the app/web pages, subsequent changes are best communicated to the coders via simple sketches or wireframes; then replicated in code without hi-fidelity design. Would love to see that reality change, so I am going to keep an eye on this topic. Great post!
